question: In the 1960s, many environmental artists began to view their art as a(n)
What is a common theme throughout Helen and Newton Harrison’s career?
a: Their artwork critiqued consumerism and capitalism.
b: Their artwork examined the intersection of technology and nature.
c: Their artwork had a tangible impact on the environment.
d: Their artwork experimented with multi-media installations.

question: How did Shrimp Farm differ from previous environmental artworks?
b: It interjected fictional narratives into real-world ecosystems.
c: It relied on consultation from environmental scientists and researchers.
d: It explored abstract concepts of time and space.
e: It consciously involved the interactivity of the ecosystems.

question: Which series of artworks by the Harrisons marked their shift from focusing on closed living systems to open ones?
Hans Haacke played a critical role in all of the following contemporary art movements EXCEPT
How did Haacke engage with the idea of ecological systems in his earlier works like Condensation Cube?
a: by simulating weather systems with real-time data feeds
b: by creating soundscapes that were integral to the artworks
c: by integrating mechanical systems into kinetic sculptures
d: by enclosing systems within the material of his artwork
e: by using statistical data to illustrate economic systems

question: Which of the following issues did Haacke address in Rhine Water Purification Plant?
Sun Tunnels explored all of the following concepts EXCEPT
a: the deep time of light that travels from the stars
c: ancient geological time of the American West
d: the Earth’s annual orbit around the Sun

Which open-source project did Huyghe create through co-authorship with many artists?
How does Untilled represent a turning point in Huyghe’s career?
a: It marks a shift towards producing contemporary eco art.
b: It showcases newfound experimentation with kinetic sculptures.
